comment: The photo has a lot of potential given the subjects and the background, but it needs some tweaks. First, I would place the girl and dog in the middle of the image instead of being to the side. This would help balance the image. In this case, following the rule of thirds doesn't really make sense. I would also try to omit the sky from the image and have the background be completely composed of greenery. This would make the photo look more balanced and eliminate the weird fogginess at the top, which is currently detracting from the image, in my opinion. I would also experiment with positioning the subjects to get a more impressive pose. For example, have the dog next to the girl instead of directly in front. My reasoning for this is that the dog is pitch black and is blending in with the girl's shoes. Having the dog to the side would help it stand out.

However, if I had to adjust something, I would decrease the proportion of sky captured in the photo. I would try having the proportion be closer to 1:3, sky to mountain. It's currently 40:60. comment: The photo is a cool background attempt. I think the lighting needs adjustment, though. The middle section is overexposed, and the image would benefit from a decrease in ISO to remedy that, while also increasing the resolution. If that's not possible, I would try a black and white filter on the whole image. Otherwise, the yellows need to be turned down to bring out the green color in the leaves. The tree on the bottom left already seems black and white, which is why I suggested going with that color grading for the whole image. Besides that, the focus is very good, and I like that the branches create these intricate black silhouettes.

I would have taken the photo a few minutes earlier, while the sun was still slightly higher during the sunset. That would help light up the field without overexposing the sky. If the exposure were increased now to make the field clearer, the sky where the sun is would look overblown. comment: I really like this photo. It shows a spider in action, capturing its prey. The spider is decently in focus, taking into consideration how difficult it is to get a macro shot like this. The lighting is very good, and the color grading is also on point.

I like the way this image is composed. The use of the barrier as a leading line, taking the viewer's eyes to the people sitting, is very nice. I like how the people are just black silhouettes and there are no distracting details showing up on them. I love how the sun is melting into the surrounding clouds and sky. It looks unique and adds another layer to the photo. The sea is also well captured and in focus despite the waves moving. One small thing I would adjust is turning down the ISO a bit to improve the photo resolution. To compensate for that, the shutter speed can be increased slightly.
